channel.title: Devops on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Devops on Notes

item.title: Kubernetes
item.description: Basics Kubernetes is the operating system for cloud-native applications. Configuration cat ~/.kube/config # or kubectl config view Namespace group of objects in a cluster similar to a filesystem folder see Namespaces for more # your current namespace kubectl config get-contexts # search for asterisk and see column NAMESPACE # all namespaces in a cluster kubectl get namespaces Context to change the default namespace more permanently to manage different clusters to manage different users # list contexts kubectl config get-contexts # switch context kubectl config use-context <context-name> Objects Basic objects

item.title: Docker
item.description: Docker is a container technology. Cointainers standardize software packaging. It’s a well timed fusion of kernel features (cgroups, namespaces) filesystem tricks (UnionFS) networking hacks (iptables) Think of a container not as a virtual machine but a very lightweight wrapper around an isolated group of processes. These processes are restricted to private root filesystem and process namespace. Docker revision-controls: filesystem layers image tags Architecture Terminology Docker server - the docker command run in daemon mode on a Linux host:
